t: A Psalm of David. A song at the dedication of the temple.
I*pn will extol you, O Lord,*s for you have drawn me up and*ld have not let my foes rejoice over me.
O*ln Lord*s my God, I cried to you for help, and*ld you have healed me.
O*ln Lord,*s you have brought up my soul from Sheol; you*ld restored me to life from among those who go down to the pit.
Sing*pn praises to the Lord,*s O you his saints, and*ld give thanks to his holy name.
For*ln his anger is but for a moment, and*ld his favor is for a lifetime. Weeping*ln may tarry for the night, but*ld joy comes with the morning.
As*pn for me, I said in my prosperity, “I*ld shall never be moved.”
By*ln your favor, O Lord,*s you*ld made my mountain stand strong; you*ln hid your face; I*ld was dismayed.
To*pn you, O Lord,*s I cry, and*ld to the Lord I plead for mercy:
“What*ln profit is there in my death, if*ld I go down to the pit? Will*ln the dust praise you? Will*ld it tell of your faithfulness?
Hear,*ln O Lord,*s and be merciful to me! O*ld Lord,*s be my helper!”
You*pn have turned for me my mourning into dancing; you*ld have loosed my sackcloth and*ld clothed me with gladness,
that*ln my glory may sing your praise and not be silent. O*ld Lord*s my God, I will give thanks to you forever!
